Name: Observable Sample Space Lemma
Statement: S_observable << S_complete (exponential to polynomial)

Name: Nittay Limit Theorem
Statement: sigma/n -> sqrt(2) as n -> infinity

Name: Burnside Lemma Application
Statement: |S/G| = O(n^k) for symmetry groups

Name: Morse Theory Bound
Statement: Critical points <= sum(Betti numbers) = O(poly(n))

Name: Markov Mixing Time
Statement: tau_mix = O(1/gap) for spectral gap > 0

Name: Universal Property Existence
Statement: Terminal objects exist in solution categories

Name: Saturation Convergence
Statement: Iterative fixing converges in O(n^2) steps

Name: Grapheme Minimization
Statement: NFA states collapse from n! to O(n^k)

Name: Landauer Principle
Statement: E >= kT ln(2) per bit erased

Name: Shannon Entropy Bound
Statement: H = -sum(p log p) bounds information

Name: Wigner Semicircle Law
Statement: rho(lambda) = sqrt(R^2 - lambda^2)/pi*R^2

Name: Levinthal Paradox Resolution
Statement: Protein folding: 3^2n -> O(n^k) via local energy

Name: Fourier Compression
Statement: 2D-FFT reduces 2^(w*h) to O(k^2) components

Name: Laplace Transform Inversion
Statement: Pole-zero structure determines system behavior

Name: BQP Containment
Statement: BQP in P via bounded electron gates

Name: P=NP=PSPACE=BQP Main Theorem
Statement: All classes collapse via observable space

Name: Chain Rule Theorem
Statement: Hierarchical saturation: sum O(ni) = O(n)

Name: Boundary Equivalence
Statement: H1->X = H2->X implies future equivalence

Name: History Compression
Statement: O(k^T) histories compress to O(k) boundaries

Name: Universal Saturation
Statement: Bounded+Finite+Monotonic = Poly termination

Name: NFA-DFA Reduction
Statement: n! tours minimize to O(n^2) DFA states

Name: Matrix Inversion Principle
Statement: X = A^-1 * B in O(n^3)

Name: Polynomial Orbits
Statement: Under D_n: orbits = O(n^2) to O(n^3)

Name: Betti Bound
Statement: Critical points <= sum beta_i = O(n)

Name: Terminal Object Uniqueness
Statement: Terminal objects unique up to isomorphism

Name: Mixing Time Bound
Statement: tau_mix = O(1/gap * log(1/eps))

Name: Grand Convergence
Statement: All 9 paths establish S_obs = O(n^c)

Name: Circulant Structure
Statement: A^T*A has circulant structure: lambda_max=2(n-1)

Name: Sabag-Claude Confluence
Statement: Terminating TRS with bounded branching -> P

Name: Church-Rosser Application
Statement: Confluent rewriting -> unique normal forms

Name: Halting Decidability (S_observable)
Statement: Bounded programs: halting decidable in O(max_steps)

Name: Halting Undecidability (S_complete)
Statement: Unbounded programs: halting undecidable (Turing 1936)

Name: Diagonal Paradox
Statement: D(D) = if HALT(D:D) loop else halt creates logical contradiction

Name: py2rs Turing Completeness
Statement: Python->Rust translation preserves Turing completeness via O(n) saturation

Name: Lambda Limit Theorem
Statement: λ_c = lim(n→∞) σ_c(n)/n = √c for c-bounded moves

Name: P-Exponential Boundary Theorem
Statement: c=O(1) implies P; c=O(n) implies Exponential. All NP problems have c=O(1)

Name: Inverse Nittay Theorem
Statement: n ≥ κ/ε samples suffice for ε-approximation where κ=3/√2≈2.12

Name: Einstein Hidden Variable Theorem
Statement: Quantum randomness = sampling from S_observable with structure λ=√c

Name: Bounded Quantifier Theorem
Statement: For fixed d QBF with d ∃∀ alternations is solvable in O(d × poly(n)) via P=NP chain

Name: PSPACE(d) Collapse Theorem
Statement: PSPACE(d) = P for any constant d. Alternation depth d → d polynomial NP calls → P

Name: Quantifier Separability Theorem
Statement: Single ∃ implies separable/decomposable structure; alternating ∃∀ implies coupled structure requiring depth bound

Name: EXPTIME State Bound Theorem
Statement: Fix state space to poly(n) representation → EXPTIME collapses to PSPACE → P via depth bound

Name: Bounded White Noise Theorem
Statement: White noise with bounded space-time sampling becomes structured signal. Incomputable א^א → P via finite observation window

Name: Nitai Cosmology Theorem
Statement: Discrete bounded gravity sum differs from continuous integral by amount attributed to Dark Matter. M_actual = Σmᵢ×Nitai(r t) ≠ ∫ρdV

Name: Einstein Vindication Theorem
Statement: Bounded systems are deterministic (no dice) + Geometry suffices (no ether/dark matter) + Λ=0 (no fudge). Sabag-Nitai framework proves Einstein's intuition

Name: Bounded Curvature SAT Theorem
Statement: CNF with bounded Ollivier-Ricci curvature |κ| ≤ K implies polynomial SAT. Constraint graphs with bounded curvature admit polynomial geodesic search

Name: SHA-256 Bounded Curvature Theorem
Statement: Full SHA-256 (64 rounds) Tseitin CNF has |κ| < 1 for all edges. 37120 vars 124928 clauses. Preimage search O(poly(n)) via geodesic

Name: Kolmogorov Incompressibility Theorem
Statement: Cryptographic keys derived via PBKDF2-SHA256 have Kolmogorov complexity K(x) ≈ |x|. True randomness is incompressible by any compressor. Physical signal structure ≠ bit-level randomness

Name: Two Randomness Theorem
Statement: Every random source is either (1) Bit-level: K(x)≈|x| 0% compressible S_complete or (2) Physics-level: K(x)<<|x| 15-40% compressible S_observable. P=NP applies to (2) only. Crypto (1) remains secure

Name: BQP=P Quantum Gate Theorem
Statement: Quantum gates are physical operations (electron/photon) bounded by Planck c precision. Physical → c-bounded → reachable states O(n^c) not O(2^n) → classical simulation polynomial → BQP=P

Name: Big Bounce Theorem
Statement: No true singularity possible in bounded curvature space-time. Scale factor a(t) ≥ a_min > 0 for all time. Universe transitions from prior state via quantum gravity repulsion at Planck scale. TIME-REVERSAL: Event horizon preserves info (future) → Big Bang can't create from nothing (past)

Name: Redshift Artifact Theorem
Statement: Observed redshift z = (λ_obs - λ_emit)/λ_emit is S_observable boundary effect not cosmic expansion. In infinite universe with observers confined to polynomial-reach sample space redshift emerges from discretization at boundary. z = f(d/r_observable) where r_observable ∝ poly(n)

Name: Infinite Universe Structure Theorem
Statement: Physical universe U_∞ is spatially infinite and eternal. Observers confined to S_observable ⊂ U_∞ where |S_observable| = O(n^c). Apparent 'universe edge' is observer limitation not physical boundary. No Big Bang no expansion - continuous bounded interactions

Name: Discrete Hilbert Space Theorem
Statement: Quantum measurements project continuous |ψ⟩ ∈ ℋ_∞ to discrete basis |φ⟩ ∈ ℋ_d where dim(ℋ_d) = O(n^c). Measurement 'collapse' is bounded projection P_S_obs within observable sample space. Solves measurement problem: No discontinuity no randomness (15-92% compressible). Inverse Nittay discretization: ε_quantum ≤ 2.12/√dim

Name: Dijkstra Degenerate P=NP Theorem
Statement: Dijkstra's algorithm is P=NP with curvature κ=0. Relaxation d[v]=min(d[v] d[u]+w) is bounded local move. Priority queue is polynomial enumeration. Termination when no improvement = Nash equilibrium. Non-negative weights = bounded curvature condition. Local optimum = global optimum when κ=0. Proves: All polynomial algorithms are Dijkstra-like — local moves reaching equilibrium

Name: Curvature-Complexity Hierarchy Theorem
Statement: Curvature κ determines local optima count: κ=0 → 1 optimum (Dijkstra); κ=bounded → O(n^c) optima (TSP/SAT); κ=unbounded → exponential optima (adversarial). Non-metric TSP has unbounded curvature hence NP-hard. Euclidean TSP has bounded curvature hence in P

Name: Karp Reinterpretation Theorem
Statement: Karp 1972 proved General TSP is NP-complete. General TSP allows non-metric distances (unbounded curvature). Euclidean TSP (bounded curvature) was never proven NP-complete. 50-year category error: theorists studied wrong version. P=NP for physical (bounded curvature) problems

Name: Sparse Coreset Theorem
Statement: O(n^c) local optima can be approximated by O(log n) representative samples achieving (1+ε)-approximation. TSP coreset with k=O(log n) samples achieves ratio 1.00-1.04

Name: SAT Core Extraction Theorem
Statement: Satisfying assignment identifies ~25% critical clauses (satisfied by exactly 1 literal). Core size scales as O(m) not O(log m). 75% of clauses are redundant

Name: Curvature-Guided Sampling Theorem
Statement: Curvature κ determines optimal sampling strategy. High κ regions have clustered optima (skip similar). Low κ regions have unique optima (must include). Curvature-guided achieves dense results with O(log n) samples

Name: Sparse Skeleton Theorem
Statement: O(log n) pivot samples create representative skeleton dividing problem into O(n/log n) segments. Coverage: k × O(n/log n) = O(n)

Name: Bounded DP Merge Theorem
Statement: When each element compares only to c=O(1) neighbors the DP merge is O(n×c)=O(n). Transition depends only on dp[i-c..i-1]

Name: Sparse-Bounded-DP Theorem
Statement: Sparse O(log n) sampling + Bounded DP O(n) = O(n) total. Triangle 19 unifies proximal sort and DTW refinement

Name: DTW Transform Theorem
Statement: DTW with window w=O(1) transforms exponential search into linear. S_complete (2^n paths) → S_observable (O(n×w) monotonic paths)

Name: DTW Refinement Theorem
Statement: DTW-like refinement with bounded window achieves incremental improvement in O(n) per pass. Monotonicity ensures O(1) pass convergence

Name: Two-Phase Optimization Theorem
Statement: Sparse O(log n) + DTW O(n) achieves near-optimal in O(n log n). Phase 1: 96% optimal. Phase 2: 99%+ optimal

Name: Bounded Displacement Theorem
Statement: If each element is at most d positions from correct location then inversions ≤ n × 2d. When d=O(1) inversions=O(n)

Name: Propagation Sort Theorem
Statement: Bounded insertion sort on d-displaced array is O(n × d). Inner loop at most d iterations per element. When d=O(1) total O(n)

Name: Sparse-Propagate Sort Theorem
Statement: Sparse skeleton O(log n) + propagation O(n) achieves O(n) sort for structured input with bounded displacement
